chapter.title: Context Menu Preferences and Options
chapter.para: To adjust the project specific preferences, you should bring the context menu for your project and select the Preferences option. More details on what adjustments you can perform in the Preferences screen, see in the "JBoss Tools Preferences" chapter.
Under the JBoss Tools option in the context menu there are also several actions provided by JBDS:

section.title: Add/Remove Struts Capabilities
section.para: Please, for details refer to the Struts Tools Reference Guide.

section.title: Add/Remove JSF Capabilities
section.para: Please, for details refer to the JSF Tools Reference Guide.

section.title: Add Custom Capabilities
section.para: You can add custom capabilities to any JSF, Struts or Seam project made within JBDS, i.e. add a support of additional frameworks built on top of JSF, such as
When the option is selected, the Add Custom Capabilities dialog appears. You should check the needed modules and press Finish.
The next page displays all the updates that have been made to the project.
